title: An article is sold at a certain price. If it is sold at 80% of this price, then there will be a loss of 10%. What is the percentage profit when the article is sold at the original selling price? - Quora
tags: SSC - Combined Higher Secondary Level Exam (CHSL)
Staff Selection Commission Combined Graduate Level Exam

response.answer_text: Let s.p be x Now sold at 80%, x×80/100=4x/5 C.p=(4x/5)(100/90)=8x/9 Loss is 10% L=x-4x/5=x/5 When sold at x, P=x-8x/9=x/9 For 8x/9…………profit is x/9 For 100…………………………..? 100(x/9)(9/8x)=25/2=12and a half%
Let the original selling price be 100X If you sell at 80X loss is 10% So cost = 100/90 *80X = 88.89X so if it sold at 100X the profit% = 11.11/88.89 *100 = 12.5% ANSWER 12.5% gain
